subject: p11879886
Findings: PA and lateral views of the chest were obtained. Midline sternotomy wires and mediastinal clips are again noted. The lungs appear clear bilaterally without definite signs of pneumonia or CHF. The patient is known to have multiple pulmonary metastases which are not well seen. A lesion in the left lower lobe projects over the posterior margin of the heart on the lateral view. A nodular opacity is again noted in the left upper lobe. No pleural effusion or pneumothorax. Heart size is stable. Mediastinal contour is also stable. Bony structures appear intact.
Impression: Known lung metastases are again noted though better assessed on prior CT. No definite signs of superimposed acute process.
